study_plan_entry.title: Introduction to digital signal processing using Matlab, applied to environmental sciences and civil engineering

free_text.Learning outcomes: Provide civil engineers signal processing tools and bases in order to process and interpret monitoring datasets and give a practical introduction to matlab.[br/]
free_text.Content: The course will be held in two parts, the first part deals with basics of signal processing. [br/]The fourier transform, sampling, spectral analysis and signal filtering are presented. [br/]Also coding and plotting with matlab is introduced using practical examples.[br/]In a second time during practical work a dataset has to be processed using matlab. The students can use their own dataset ( accelerometers, displacement, impact-echo, etc ...), if they have none a ground penetrating radar dataset will be provided. [br/]
free_text.Keywords: Signal processing, Matlab, for civil engineers

en.title: Introduction to digital signal processing using Matlab, applied to environmental sciences and civil engineering

fr.title: Introduction to digital signal processing using Matlab, applied to environmental sciences and civil engineering
